fields.description: We like the filtering options in the 'content by label' macro and would love to see that flexibility in the 'label list' and 'popular labels' macros. I'd bet there's similar macros that could use it too but those are the ones we're using. Thanks!
fields.summary: Upgrade filters in 'label list' and 'popular labels' macros

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is not a clear way to change the logging location for {{<Confluence-Install>/logs/atlassian-synchrony-proxy.log}} or {{<Confluence-Install>/logs/synchrony-proxy-watchdog.log}}. 

It’s not possible to edit the locations in log4j.properties, since it’s not Tomcat logging. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to manage the locations of Synchrony log files. 

h3. Why this is important
Some users have size constraints on different directories. Logging takes up a lot of space, so being able to manage where log files are written would be helpful to maintaining directory sizes.
fields.summary: Customize logging locations for atlassian-synchrony-proxy.log and and synchrony-proxy-watchdog.log

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Set Indexing Language to "German* 
# Add two labels ("f-ffffffffffffff-ffff-ffffffffff/fffffffffff" and "f-medizintechnik-ohne-endoskopie/ultraschall") to a page
# Searching for labelText:"f-ffffffffffffff-ffff-ffffffffff/fffffffffff" works
# Searching for labelText:"f-medizintechnik-ohne-endoskopie/ultraschall" does not work (does not list the page)

*Test Page:*
 !2018-04-26 test page.png|thumbnail! 

*Search for labelText:"f-ffffffffffffff-ffff-ffffffffff/fffffffffff"*
 !2018-04-26 label that can not be searched.png|thumbnail! 

*labelText:"f-medizintechnik-ohne-endoskopie/ultraschall"*
 !2018-04-26 label that can be searched.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note/Workaround 
* This behavior doesn't happen when the indexing language is being set to "English"
fields.summary: Unable to search for labels if indexing language is set to 'German'

fields.description:
In user macros after adding documentation with a relative link, when editing the macro with the MacroEditor the "Documentation" url points to:

*"https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-67/<my relative link>"*

It doesn't explicitly say when saving a user macro or here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/writing-user-macros-4485.html|http://example.com/], but shouldn't this be *my* server's base url of:

*"https://my.server.com/<my relative link>"*

To replicate:
 # Create a basic user macro, add a relative link in the documentation field.
 # Use the new macro in a page, and try out the Documentation link at the top of the MacroEditor.
fields.summary: Relative 'Documentation' links in macro editor use wrong base url

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence has the feature to create a template. However is not able to create multiple pages with the same template with a click of a button. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to create multiple pages with a template with a unique name(selected by the user)

h3. Why this is important
Imagine an organization with many new users. Having this feature will enable less admin work for a user. 

h3. Workaround 
Install BobSwitch plugin 
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cli/cloud/overview

How to use BobSwitch 
* https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSOAP/pages/10584070/How+to+create+pages+from+template+pages
fields.summary: Create multiple page with unique name with one button
Styled page view contains "\n" sequences

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The template associated with the *Deploy from VPC* link on https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence-data-center/ has issues and is not deploying properly, while the latest template from our Bitbucket repository: [atlassian-aws-deployment|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/] works without issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse to https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence-data-center/
# Click *Deploy into an existing VPC*
# Complete the configuration as noted in the [Deployment Guide|https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/confluence/latest/doc/confluence-data-center-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf]

h3. Expected Results
A new Confluence Data Center instance is deployed into the existing VPC without issue

h3. Actual Results
# The below exception is thrown in AWS:
{noformat}
We run into the following CFN Errors:
CREATE_FAILED	AWS::Route53::RecordSet	EFSCname	No hosted zones named found

CREATE_FAILED	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	ConfluenceSaml	The following resource(s) failed to create: [EFSMountAz2, EFSCname, ConfluenceClusterNodeInstanceProfile, LoadBalancer, EFSMountAz1, DB].{noformat}
# In a different stack with the same VPC we found that the stack went through successfully, however the EC2 node doesn't look like it ever installs Confluence
# Deploying into a new VPC also generated:
{code}
CREATE_FAILED	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	ConfluenceDCStack	Embedded stack arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:795557146740:stack/CDCTEST-ConfluenceDCStack-3WZ56RG26FVQ/45d6fa50-4cad-11e8-92ed-50a686fc37d2 was not successfully created: The following resource(s) failed to create: [EFSMountAz2, EFSCname, ConfluenceClusterNodeInstanceProfile, LoadBalancer, EFSMountAz1, DB].

CREATE_FAILED	AWS::Route53::RecordSet	EFSCname	No hosted zones named found

CREATE_FAILED	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	CDCTEST-ConfluenceDCStack-3WZ56RG26FVQ	The following resource(s) failed to create: [EFSMountAz2, EFSCname, ConfluenceClusterNodeInstanceProfile, LoadBalancer, EFSMountAz1, DB].
{code}

h3. Notes
Diffing the newest working template and the broken template from AWS there appear to be 2 missing condition statements:
 !diff-working-broken.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Latest Working Template from Bitbucket
{code}
EFSCname:
    Type: AWS::Route53::RecordSet
    Condition: UseHostedZone
    Properties:
      HostedZoneName: !Ref HostedZone
      Comment: Route53 cname for the efs
      Name: !Join ['.', [!Ref "AWS::StackName", 'efs', !Ref 'HostedZone']]
      Type: CNAME
      TTL: '900'
      ResourceRecords:
        - !Join ['.', [!Ref ElasticFileSystem, 'efs', !Ref "AWS::Region", 'amazonaws.com.']]

LoadBalancerCname:
    Condition: UseHostedZone
    Type: AWS::Route53::RecordSet
    Properties:
      HostedZoneName: !Ref HostedZone
      Comment: Route53 cname for the ALB
      Name: !Sub
        - "${SubDomainName}.${HostedZone}"
        - SubDomainName: !If [UseSubDomainName, !Ref "SubDomainName", !Ref "AWS::StackName"]
          HostedZone: !Ref "HostedZone"
      Type: CNAME
      TTL: '900'
      ResourceRecords:
        - !GetAtt LoadBalancer.DNSName
{code}

h5. Broken Template from AWS Website
{code}
 EFSCname:
    Type: AWS::Route53::RecordSet
    Properties:
      HostedZoneName: !Ref HostedZone
      Comment: Route53 cname for the efs
      Name: !Join ['.', [!Ref "AWS::StackName", 'efs', !Ref 'HostedZone']]
      Type: CNAME
      TTL: '900'
      ResourceRecords:
        - !Join ['.', [!Ref ElasticFileSystem, 'efs', !Ref "AWS::Region", 'amazonaws.com.']]

 LoadBalancerCname:
    Type: AWS::Route53::RecordSet
    Properties:
      HostedZoneName: !Ref HostedZone
      Comment: Route53 cname for the ALB
      Name: !Sub
        - "${SubDomainName}.${HostedZone}"
        - SubDomainName: !If [UseSubDomainName, !Ref "SubDomainName", !Ref "AWS::StackName"]
          HostedZone: !Ref "HostedZone"
      Type: CNAME
      TTL: '900'
      ResourceRecords:
        - !GetAtt LoadBalancer.DNSName
{code}

Without the Condition statement, the EFS nodes cannot be created without a R53 Hosted Zone. 
* Working template:  [^Confluence-April29.template]  
* AWSQuickstart broken template: [^AWSQuickStart-ConfluenceDataCenter-4.template] 

h3. Workaround
Deploy an older working template from our [Bitbucket Repository: atlassian-aws-deployment|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/]
fields.summary: Current AWS template for Confluence is missing 2 condition statements

fields.description:
See video.
 - Hitting the delete keyboard button on some dates caused individual characters in the date lozenge to be deleted (but the first character and the calendar symbol couldn't be deleted)
 - Hitting the delete keyboard button on some dates caused the cursor to jump outside of the table.

Notes

Individual characters can be deleted in case where a date lozenge is copied from view mode to edit mode. The same behaviour can be observed with the status lozenge. This is because the editor treats the pasted content as-is and does not try to convert it.
fields.summary: Unable to delete date lozenge in tables

fields.description:
Hello - We are having an issue where we want to see all content created by an inactive user but the Contributor field does not display any inactive user.  Due to this we cannot search on it.  

We would like to have an option to pull in all users into the contributors field or a flag to determine whether to add those people.
fields.summary: Search for inactive users

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, when a Confluence page contains a table and the user set the table width to fix size and export it to pdf. The table will be auto resize when exporting to pdf, Some customer would like to export the table column with fix width and some would like to export the table as auto resize.

h3. Suggestion
As a suggestion, a feature to allow the customer to configure the table width to be fix or auto resize when the customer exporting the page to pdf.
fields.summary: Allow user to configure table column width to be fix size or auto resize when exporting to pdf

fields.description:
h3. Description
When customers is trying to upgrade confluence from version 5.8 and below directly to confluence 6, the upgrade process is not completed and failed. However, if the customer rollback to the previous working version and upgrade to 5.10.8 and proceed to confluence 6, the upgrade is completed without any issue.
confluence upgrade documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/upgrading-confluence-4578.html

h3. Suggestion
As there is a major change from 5.10 to 6, it would be recommended to first upgrade to 5.10 and proceed to 6 for more stability.
fields.summary: Suggest to update the upgrade documentation to first upgrade to 5.10.8 before upgrading to confluence 6 and above.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bastion hosts are now required (minimum host count is 1) for the Confluence AWS CloudFormation Quick Start. In environments where bastion hosts already exist or are not needed, this is excess infrastructure that has to be taken down after every time the template is ran. If this infrastructure is not cleaned up this will lead to unnecessary cost.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to skip adding the bastion host by allowing the bastion section to be set to 0 hosts or provide an option to skip bastion hosts altogether. Ideally we could skip this section so that no extra infrastructure is built.
fields.summary: Make adding Bastion Hosts Optional in AWS

fields.description:
h3. Bug Summary:

Scheduled jobs settings are reverted back after Confluence restart
h3. Bug description

Test case: user wants to adjust "Send Batched Notifications" execution schedule from default value (every 10 minutes) to once per day at any given hour. 
 Send Batched Notifications scheduled job/cron setting can be adjusted by opening Confluence Administration -> Scheduled Jobs -> Send Batched notifications (sample scheduled job) -> Edit. 
 Then adjust Cron Expression to "0 0 16 * * ?" (At 16:00:00 every day) from default "0 0/10 * 1/1 * ? *"

Next Send Batched Notifications will be executed at 16:00 but  after Confluence restart old 10 minutes interval is used.
h3. Steps to replicate
 * Setup clean Confluence instance
 * Verify in application that scheduledjob "Send Batched Notifications" uses default value for "Send Batched Notifications":
 Confluence Administration -> Scheduled Jobs -> Send Batched notifications -> Edit
 verify Send Batched Notifications settings in the database
{code:java}
select * from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig':
# output
68;"com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration";"DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig";"<com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration>
 <enabled>
 <value>1</value>
 </enabled>
 <cronSchedule/>
 <repeatInterval/>
</com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration>"
{code}

 * Go to Confluence Administration -> Scheduled Jobs -> Send Batched notifications -> Edit
 change cron expression to "0 0 16 * * ?" , click on save
 verify in the database
{code:java}
select * from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig'
# output
68;"com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration";"DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig";"<com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration>
 <enabled>
 <value>1</value>
 </enabled>
 <cronSchedule>
 <value class="string">0 0 16 * * ?</value>
 </cronSchedule>
 <repeatInterval/>
</com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJ (...)"
{code}

 * Wait for the next scheduled execution specified in custom cron expression
 * Wait ~1hr (to see if scheduled jobs are not executed in old 10 minutes interval)
 * Restart Confluence

h3. Expected results

After Confluence restart "Send Batched notifications" is executed according to custom cron expression (16:00:00 every day)
h3. Actual results
 * After Confluence restart "Send Batched notifications" job is executed every 10 minutes:
 !after_restart.png|thumbnail!

 * database contains adjusted rows corresponding to cron job:
{code:java}
6. select * from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig'
68;"com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration";"DEFAULT#batchingJobConfig";"<com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobConfiguration>
 <enabled>
 <value>1</value>
 </enabled>
 <cronSchedule>
 <value class="string">0 0 16 * * ?</value>
 </cronSchedule>
 <repeatInterval/>
</com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJ (...)"
{code}

 * Batch edit option points to correct values:
 * !Screenshot_20180430_153608.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Edit again the scheduled job and simply click on *Save* and the job will again be executed according to the entered cron expression.
This will be need to be done every time Confluence is restarted for all scheduled jobs that have been edited.
 
h3. Notes

This also affects custom Caesium based jobs created by 3rd party apps, such as *Better Content Archiving for Confluence* and *Gliffy Diagrams for Confluence*.
 However not all built-in jobs are affected, for example it does not affect the job *Clean Old Audit Records*.
fields.summary: Scheduled jobs settings are reverted back after Confluence restart

	at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher.serviceAction(ConfluenceServletDispatcher.java:56)
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:199)
{code}
As we can see there, both threads are locked by <0x00007f083ee6cb28>. Unfortunately, stacktrace does not show us which thread locks <0x00007f083ee6cb28>. For example, it could happen if a thread was created, acquired the lock than was killed without releasing the lock.
h1. How to check that your Confluence instance is affected by this issue

If Confluence pages return 500x errors, please do the following:
 1. Create the first thread dump and then the second one in a minute
 2. Run this command on each dump:
{code:java}
cat <thread-dump>  | egrep "(MemoryStore.put|MemoryStore.get)" -B 10
{code}
3. If you see two threads which are waiting for the same lock, you are affected by this issue. Both thread dumps should have the same lock id. 
h1. More Information & Workaround

[Confluence Throws 500 Error Due To Lock Timeout In Vcachelock|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-throws-500-error-due-to-lock-timeout-in-vcachelock-961783876.html]
fields.summary: Lock leaking in Ehcache

fields.description:
h3. Description
When using the installer to perform the backup, it will ask if the admin wants to perform a backup before the upgrade. If the user unchecks the backup option, the installer will still perform the backup.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Download a confluence installer
# Run the installer
# Select upgrade existing confluence
# Point to an existing installation directory
# Uncheck the option to perform backup
# Click next

*Expected result*
The upgrade task will proceed without performing the backup

*Actual result*
The backup is performed before the upgrade.

h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create space with at least 30000 pages. Problem will be easier to observe with more pages
 # Add a page with the {{index}} macro
 # Save

h2. Expected behavior

Page renders quickly with the macro indicating that page index cannot be displayed due to space containing more than 5000 pages
h2. Actual behavior

The page takes a long time to render. It will eventually show the expected message above, OR it will show a 120 second macro timeout given enough pages (which occurred at ~130k pages in my testing).
h2. Analysis

Through SQL logging we can see that Confluence does indeed issue a query to count pages in the space, and the results are correctly received. The below is pulled from a test Confluence 6.6.2 instance where the space has 129077 pages.
{code:java}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The task report macro can execute long running SQL queries and take a lot of memory if the macro is added with the default parameters. It happens because the plugin loads all active tasks to memory.

Example SQL query:
{code:sql}
select distinct t."GLOBAL_ID" , t."CONTENT_ID", case when cu.lower_display_name is null then 0 else 1 end CU_LOWER_DISPLAY_NAME,
cu.lower_display_name, t."CREATE_DATE" 
from "AO_BAF3AA_AOINLINE_TASK" t 
join CONTENT c on t."CONTENT_ID" = c.CONTENTID 
join SPACES s on c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID 
left join user_mapping um on t."ASSIGNEE_USER_KEY" = um.user_key 
left join cwd_user cu on um.lower_username = cu.lower_user_name
WHERE s.SPACESTATUS <> 'ARCHIVED' AND c.CONTENT_STATUS <> 'deleted' AND
t."TASK_STATUS" = 'UNCHECKED' ORDER BY CU_LOWER_DISPLAY_NAME DESC, cu.lower_display_name ASC, t."CREATE_DATE" DESC
{code}
h3. Cause

Two issues:
 # *DB issue:* we scan all records from AO_BAF3AA_AOINLINE_TASK (tasks), CONTENT, cwd_user, user_mapping tables, filter them and join them. It is an expensive operation.
 # *JVM issue:* for example, if we have 100K active tasks, DB will return a dataset with 100K records. It requires allocating a lot of objects and will require a lot of GC work later.

h3. How to reproduce
 # Have a lot of active tasks
 # Create a page and add a task report macro with default parameters

h3. Workaround

*Workaround 1* Remove task reports with "show ALL tasks" settings.

To find all pages that use this macro, follow these steps:
 # Navigate to Confluence Administration > Macro Usage
 # Under Confluence Inline Tasks, the macro tasks-report-macro will be listed, it will show how many pages the macro is on alongside
 # Click tasks-report-macro to view a list of pages containing the macro

*Workaround 2* Disable the macro
 # Navigate to Confluence Administration > Manage Add-ons
 # Search for "task" with the All add-ons filter applied
 # Under Confluence Inline Tasks expand the + 51 of 51 modules expander
 # Find Task report (tasks-report) in the list, and click Disable
fields.summary: The task report macro can execute long running SQL queries and cause performance degradation

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When Jira issues are inserted in an 'Excerpt' macro, the issues do not load in the 'Page Tree' macro when you enable the "*Include Excerpts in Page Tree*" option.

h4. Steps to replicate
# Create a parent page with 2 child pages.
# In the 2 child pages, insert an 'Excerpt' macro with a Jira issue inside.
# In the parent page, insert a 'Page Tree' macro and set that page itself as the "*Root Page*" and tick the "*Include Excerpts in Page Tree*" option.
# Save those pages and open up the parent page.

h4. Expected results
The 'Page Tree' macro should load the Jira issues with no problem.

h4. Actual results
The 'Page Tree' macro does not load the Jira issues and looks like this:

 !Page Tree macro.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Notes
* From local tests, a restart helps to resolve this. However, the moment you edit the page containing the 'Page Tree' macro (even without making any changes), the Jira issues don't load anymore.
* If the 'Page Tree' macro is inserted into one of the two child pages (based on the example above), the issues will load fine. It seems that it only happens when the macro is trying to load issues that are coming from other pages.
* No errors are thrown in the browser JS console or in the HAR file.
fields.summary: Jira issues in excerpts don't load in a Page Tree macro with the option 'Include Excerpts in Page Tree' enabled

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The Labels List macro is returning labels that match content which are only in the space trash. These labels should be excluded from the macro as users cannot actually access those pages in the trash.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page and add a label to it
# Create another page in the same space with the "Labels List" macro
# Delete the first page so that it goes to the space trash

h2. Expected behavior
The Labels List macro should not show the label, as there are no accessible content with that label

h2. Actual behavior
The Labels List macro still shows the label. When clicked, the ensuing page shows "There are no pages at the moment." This can be confusing to users.

h2. Workaround
* Purge the trash (which will permanently delete the page) or publish the drafts
* OR, if you wish for the page to remain in the trash, recover the page and remove the label before re-deleting it, or remove the label from the draft page
fields.summary: Labels List Macro should not include results from Space trash and Drafts

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When an Excel sheet uses a function such as "NUMBERVALUE" that was added since Excel 2013 on a numeric cell of type "Text", the value is rendered as "#NAME?" when previewing the Excel file in Confluence.

!Excel sheet.png|thumbnail!
h4. Steps to replicate
 # Create an Excel sheet with a cell (A1) of type "Text".
 # Insert a numeric value into the cell A1 – 123123.
 # Click onto the next cell (B1) and insert this formula:
{code:java}
=NUMBERVALUE(RIGHT(A1;4)){code}

 # The value "3123" will be rendered in B1 as a result of that formula.
 # Save the file and upload it to a Confluence page.
 # Preview the Excel file in Confluence

h4. Expected results

The preview will render both A1 and B1 cells as "123456" and "3456" respectively.
h4. Actual results

The preview renders A1 as "123456", but B1 as "#NAME?".
fields.summary: Support newer Excel functions from Excel 2013 such as NUMBERVALUE

fields.description:
I am interested in knowing Atlassian's position on Java updates w/ regard to Oracle's new release model:

10.x is Java's latest release - *[but this now changes every six months!|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/overview/index.html]*

For full details, please see:  [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/eol-135779.html]

This is my summary of information gathered from the link directly above:

General Availability (GA) for Release 8 was Mar 2014 with its end of public updates for commercial use after January 2019 and non-Corporate desktop use after December 2020.
  
 GA for Release 9 was Sep 2017 with its end of public updates on Mar 2018 (why you do not see 9 anymore for Java downloads)
 Java SE Downloads Site:
 [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html]

GA for Release 10 (18.3 or YY.M) Mar 2018 with its end of public updates Sep 2018

GA for Release 11 (18.9 or YY.M) is scheduled for Sep 2018 with its end of public updates TBA

My recommendation:

Knowing all this now, support for Java 9 should not be considered and developer work should stop on that - if it has not already.  Jira support requests should be created based on the new release model.  I think Atlassian should definitely focus on Release 11 as support for Java 8 may be over after January 2019.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - December 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thanks for your interest in this issue.

We are currently working on support for Java 11. Check out our update regarding all things Java on [Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Agile-articles/Java-11-OpenJDK-support-update-for-Server-and-Data-Center/ba-p/967836]

Cheers,

Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Support for Java Release 11
As a user I would like to be able to opt out of receiving emails for formatting-only changes

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*


Confluence throws a _NullPointerException_ when a .JPG attachment is not found.
Though, missing .PNG and .JPEG attachments show a *Page Not Found* error.

h3. *Testing Environment*

* Confluence v6.8.1 with PNG, JPG and JPEG images
* Confluence v6.7.2 with PNG, JPG and JPEG images
* Confluence v6.5.1 with PNG, JPG and JPEG images


h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a new Page.
# Attach an image with a .JPG extension. For example, *image1.JPG*.
# Save that page.
# Right-click the attachment and open in new-tab. The URL will be like the following,
#* {code}<Base URL>/download/attachments/327701/image1.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1524720302030&api=v2 {code}
# Update the URL to an image name which doesn't exist. 
#* {code}<Base URL>/download/attachments/327701/image2.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1524720302030&api=v2 {code}

h3. *Expected Result*

Like Confluence handles missing attachments with PNG and JPEG extensions, we should see a *Page Not Found* error.
 !Page Not Found.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Actual Result*
Confluence throws a _NullPointerException_.
 !NullPointerException.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Impact*

*Page Not Found* error paints a clear picture to the user that the attachment doesn't exist.
On the other hand _NullPointerException_ requires a deeper diagnosis to find out where the link is broken.
Also, all missing attachments should have similar response from server.

h3. *Workaround*

None.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when a JPG file is not found in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In some cases when UPM is trying to update a plugin, a deadlock occurs in the database.

The issue can be reliably reproduced with plugins that are published in the Atlassian Marketplace:

- environment: Confluence 6.7.1, 6.7.2, or 6.8.1, PostgreSQL 9.3.5
- install Scroll PDF Exporter 4.0.18
- install Scroll Versions 3.8.5
- update Scroll Versions to 3.8.7 (the latest version at the time of writing)

Relevant logs:

{code}
[p=39237, tx=5396419, vtx=7/1353] LOG:  execute S_4: update BANDANA set BANDANACONTEXT=$1, BANDANAKEY=$2, BANDANAVALUE=$3 where BANDANAID=$4
[p=39237, tx=5396419, vtx=7/1353] DETAIL:  parameters: $1 = '_GLOBAL', $2 = 'plugin.manager.state.Map', $3 = '<map>
	  <entry>
	    <string>com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-onboarding:onboarding</string>
	    <boolean>false</boolean>
	  </entry>
	  <entry>
	    <string>com.k15t.scroll.scroll-exporter-extensions:scroll.only</string>
	    <boolean>false</boolean>
	  </entry>
	</map>', $4 = '8'
[p=39237, tx=5396419, vtx=7/1353] ERROR:  deadlock detected
[p=39237, tx=5396419, vtx=7/1353] DETAIL:  Process 39237 waits for ShareLock on transaction 5396429; blocked by process 39238.
	Process 39238 waits for ShareLock on transaction 5396419; blocked by process 39237.
	Process 39237: update BANDANA set BANDANACONTEXT=$1, BANDANAKEY=$2, BANDANAVALUE=$3 where BANDANAID=$4
	Process 39238: update BANDANA set BANDANACONTEXT=$1, BANDANAKEY=$2, BANDANAVALUE=$3 where BANDANAID=$4
{code}

where:
- {{39237}} pertains to vendor transaction's update (select, update from PLUGINDATA and BANADA)
- {{39238}} pertains to {{atlassian.confluence.plugin.counter}}

It is not apparent that there is anything wrong with those plugins. It rather seems that something goes wrong when Confluence tries to dispatch the plugin install event. Further investigation shows that the Gadget Plugin (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.gadgets), which is a system plugin, is somehow involved in the deadlock. Disabling the Gadget Plugin for the duration of the update prevents the problem.

When the deadlock occurs, the log file is flooded with exceptions. Attached is a sample. Also attached, a PostgreSQL log file showing the events leading up to the deadlock (filtered for the two transactions involved).

----

I'm assuming that the Gadget Plugin causes the issue, because it is implicated both in the exception stacktraces and the PostgreSQL logs.

However, the problem also seems contingent on the specific versions of those user-installed plugins. I don't excactly know why. Interestingly, the problem does not occur :
- if version 4.1.0 of Scroll PDF Exporter is installed. 
- If the Scroll Exporter Extensions plugin, which comes bundled with the Scroll PDF Exporter and contains a number of macros, is disabled, the problem also does not occur. The new version of Scroll Versions bundles a new version of the Scroll Runtime for Confluence plugin, which both Scroll Versions and Scroll PDF Exporter depend on. 

The Scroll Exporter Extensions plugin that is bundled in Scroll PDF Exporter 4.1.0 also depends on the Scroll Runtime for Confluence (it didn't before), which means that if 4.1.0 is installed, the Scroll Exporter Extensions plugin is temporarily disabled during the update. Does the Gadget Plugin somehow mess with the macro modules of the extension plugin during the update?

Another theory we had was that the optional require-bundle dependency of Scroll PDF Exporter on Scroll Exporter Extensions could trigger the issue, but I was unable to corroborate that theory. Replacing it with a mandatory import-package dependency did not change anything.

Another observation: the actual update succeeds in that the new versions of the plugins are installed afterwards, even though UPM says that there was an error. But I'm not sure if all events, migration/upgrade tasks can complete successfully in such a case.
fields.summary: Database deadlock when updating plugin

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Each time a space is imported, Confluence will try to synchronize the directory. In case a company needs to import spaces daily, the synchronization will be triggered more than once.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be interesting to have an option to disable the synchronization of the directory in case a space is imported. Spaces should not contain users to be imported into the directory anyway, so there's no need to synchronize the directory.

h3. Why this is important

This behavior can take resources from Confluence and some spaces might fail to be imported as CONFSERVER-53197. We also have seen cases where multiple spaces were being imported, but the LDAP tree had so many users that the administrators had to wait for the synchronization to finish before importing another space.
fields.summary: Ability to disable LDAP synchronization while importing spaces

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to resize tables and align them (column width wise) easily.


h3. Problem Definition
When resizing tables manually, there is no indication of when the current column wall has reach the end of another column(much like when using PowerPoint the line snaps in place right when it aligns with another line). This leads to tables that were resized manually to easily differ in sizes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a solution similar to PowerPoint, when a line aligns with another it simply snaps into place and the user has to keep dragging after this to escape this snap.

h3. Why is this important
Creating tables for documentation and them making them aligned should be easier and straightforward.

h3. Workaround
Copy the "model table" and paste it at another location so it can be used and the column width is kept the same.
fields.summary: Easier Resizing and Alignment of Fixed Width Tables

fields.description:
h3. Summary

With the latest update 6.0.0. of Team Calendar, arrows for changing the date disappeared.
h3. Environment

Team Calendar 6.0.0.
 Confluence 6.3.4 or 6.6.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Team Calendar 6.0.0
 # Open Calendar page

h3. Expected Results

Arrows (left and right) for changing date/month will be visible.
h3. Actual Results

Arrows will be gone.
 !image_arrows.png|thumbnail!
h3. Resolution

Upgrade to Team Calendars 6.0.12 or newer, which contains a fix for this issue.
h3. Notes

Latest Confluence 6.8.1 is not affected.
h3. Workaround

If possible upgrade to latest version of Confluence.
fields.summary: Date selection arrows not visible with Team Calendars 6.0.0

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence should provide the same authentication options present in other tools for REST calls. FishEye and Crucible can be used as an example:

* https://developer.atlassian.com/server/fisheye-crucible/authenticating-rest-requests/

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the same options as in the document above for Confluence.

h3. Why this is important

For some customers, basic authentication is not an option due to security concerns.
 
h3. Workaround 

Use basic authentication.

h3. Notes

If possible, add support for OAuth version 2 for authentication when implementing extra methods.
fields.summary: Provide alternative authentication methods for REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Confluence is set to English (US), week numbers displayed in Confluence Team Calendar is not correct. For example the week 22-28 April, 2018 is shown as falling in week 16 in the calendar. The correct value should be week 17. See attachment. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log out from Confluence. 
# In the login page, select English (US) as the language of choice.
# Login to Confluence.
# Head over to *General Configuration* > *Team Calendar* > *Global Settings* and ensure that the *Display week numbers* option is set. Click *Save.*
# Head over to the Team Calendar UI. 

h3. Expected Results
Week numbers are shown with the correct value. For example the week 22-28 April, 2018 the correct value should be week 17. 

h3. Actual Results
Week numbers displayed in Confluence Team Calendar is not correct. For example the week 22-28 April, 2018 is shown as falling in week 16 in the calendar. 

h3. Notes
The behavior displayed here might be caused by the fact that in this language setting i.e. English (US) the week starts on Sunday. I have checked other calendars (MacOSX default calendar app) that have their week set as Sunday as the first day of the week and have confirmed that the behavior regarding week numbers displayed in Confluence Team Calendar is incorrect.
fields.summary: Team Calendar displays wrong week number when language is set to English (US)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the introduction of the Team Calendar 6.0, a new set of color palette was introduce. 

However upgrading to Team Calendar 6.0 from pre Team Calendar 6.0 will result in event color being  replaced with a totally different color since they do not exist in the new color palette.

In addition to that, it can be confusing for the customer as there are a few color in the new color palette that are very similar (blue,yellow, red).

h3. Suggestion
Provide an option for customer to switch back to the old color palette 

Old Color Palette
 !_thumb_2828244.png|thumbnail!    

New Color Palette
 !new color palette.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide the option to switch back to legacy color palette for Team Calendar.

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPLICATE THE ISSUE*
(i) *userb* is the user used to replicate the issue
# *userb* create a Space.
(i)  *userb* have become the Space Administrator.
# *userb* create a Page in the Space.
# *userb* attached the attachment in the page as per the screen shot below:
!userbpage.png|thumbnail!
# *userb* add *Can View and Edit* page restriction to this page to *usera* and *userc*.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
# *admin* (Confluence Administrator/superuser) login into Confluence and access the Space and Page created by *userb* and the attachments thumbnail render correctly.


*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
# *admin* (Confluence Administrator/superuser) login into Confluence and access the Space and Page created by *userb* and noticed broken thumbnail:
!adminbrokenthumbnail.png|thumbnail!
# *admin* verified that he is listed under *Can View and Edit* in the page restriction.
!adminlisted.png|thumbnail!
# *admin* able to preview the attachment upon clicking the broken thumbnail.
# However, *admin* is not listed under *Space Tools* > *Permission* > *Restricted Pages* for the affected page.
!adminnotinrestrictedpages.png|thumbnail!
# *admin* then added himself again to the page restriction with *Can View and Edit* page restriction and now able to view the attachment thumbnail.

*WORKAROUND*
*admin* (Confluence Administrator/superuser) need to add himself again with *Can View and Edit* page restriction to be able to view the attachment thumbnail.
fields.summary: Admin user seeing broken attachments thumbnails in a page if they are not granted with page restriction

fields.description:
Can the  Labels List macro  be expanded to list all labels used in the space?,with an admin configuration to allow default (existing) functionality, or our desired functionality.

The _*Labels List*_ macro allows  us to create a query by adding and subtracting labels to our search.There is a visual display issue, however, in that I would like the _*Related Labels*_ on the right side of the page to show _*all*_ labels that are present in the space. I'm not sure if Confluence restricts the number of labels that are displayed by algorithm or by size (fixed limit).

Is this a bug/feature/limitation of the macro, is there an admin configuration that can allow more labels to be displayed ?
fields.summary: Label list macro for confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you remove an existing context path from *server.xml*, this change is not reflected in the property *confluence.webapp.context.path* of the file *confluence.cfg.xml*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence
# Add a context path to server.xml as follows:
{code}
<Context path="/confluence" docBase="../confluence" debug="0" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
{code}
# Save the file and restart Confluence
# This change is reflected in confluence.cfg.xml:
{code}
<property name="confluence.webapp.context.path">/confluence</property>
{code}
# Stop Confluence
# Remove the path from server.xml
# Start Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The path is removed from the file confluence.cfg.xml as it is no longer present in server.xml:
{code}
<property name="confluence.webapp.context.path"></property>
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The path is still present in confluence.cfg.xml:
{code}
<property name="confluence.webapp.context.path">/confluence</property>
{code}

h3. Notes

No side effect of this bug can be noticed in the instance besides the discrepancy between the files.

h3.Workaround

Manually remove the path from confluence.cfg.xml and restart Confluence.
fields.summary: Context path removal on server.xml is not reflected in confluence.cfg.xml

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Images with image effects (like shadow) are not displayed in IE11 (other Browsers not affected).

h3. Environment
IE 11 and IE8

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Add a png Picture to a confluence page
# view the page in IE11, picture is displayed
# Add an effect to the picture (shadow...)
# view the page in IE11, picture is not displayed

h3. Expected Results
Image displays correctly with effect added

h3. Actual Results
Broken image

h3.Notes
* Attached screenshots of the results

h3. Workaround

* To load older version of the plugin on /atlassian-confluence-6.8.1/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/ImageEffectsPlugin-1.6.1.jar

* Steps to impement:
# Stop confluence
# Backup the file .../atlassian-confluence-6.8.1/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/ImageEffectsPlugin-1.6.1.jar
# Delete the file
# Copy ImageEffectsPlugin-1.5.4.jar to the above location
# Start Confluence

fields.description:
There is currently a system property page.index.macro.max.pages  in Confluence Server for setting the max number of pages that will be displayed by the page index macro.  The default for this system property is currently set to 5000 but it seems that for some customers this is too high.  We should lower the default to mitigate against further outages as a result of this macro.

A default of 500 or 1000 tops should be sufficient but some testing of the memory usage on large spaces should give us a good signal of what to go with.
fields.summary: Lower the default for page.index.macro.max.pages

fields.description:
Hey there,

For the roadmap planner gadget in Confluence can you please fix the following functionality:

Adding a new marker or bar always adds it to the front of the roadmap, which is not helpful if you are working at the end of the roadmap (especially on large roadmaps in a small window where you need to constantly scroll).

Ideal solution adds the marker or new bar in the place you are viewing/working.

Is this something that Atlassian could implement?

When creating a page based on a template, there are variables of type "List" where you can choose from a drop-down list of values to select.

fields.description:
One of the issues with watching Confluence pages is that our inbox is filled with email notifications every morning. It is hard to filter out what's important and what's not important using the Outlook filter.

Some ideas to help:
1. Instead of using a "notify watchers" checkmark, display a modal dialog when the client clicks "Update", which provides several explicit buttons: "Major update - Notify all watchers", "Don't notify all watchers", "Typo correction update" (or something like that). The ideas is to make the user aware that they can decide whether notifications are sent or not. I'm pretty sure watchers are not interested in knowing about minor typo corrections. If the typo is major, the editor can still hit "Notify all watchers".
2. Underneath the buttons suggested in #1, place a text box for users to provide a change log. The problem with notification emails is that we don't get a "summary" of the changes and have to scan through the email to see what has changed.
fields.summary: Ideas to reduce notification emails

tedEvent

h3. Step to reproduce the issue

*Case 1:*
 # Install Confluence question plugin.
 # Create a page called "new page link"
 # Create a question and give an answer or comment on the question including the new page link in the body.
 # Disable the Confluence question plugin
 # Open the page info for the "new page link" page

*Case 2:*
 # Install Confluence question plugin.
 # Create a page called "new page link"
 # Create a question
 # Answer the question with "new page link" inserted
 # Edit the answer

h3. Expected behavior

The page info should show all the information correctly with the incoming link.
h3. Actual behavior

The page info failed to render with the following error message on the UI:
{noformat}

	at org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.invoke(StuckThreadDetectionValve.java:206)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround solution

*Case 1:*

Enable the Confluence question plugin should solve the issue but if the plugin needs to be disabled again, please use the following query to identify the questions that cause the issue:
{code:java}
select contentid,title from content where contentid in (select distinct(c.parentccid) from content c join bodycontent bc on c.contentid = bc.contentid  where c.pluginkey in ('com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer','com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:comment') and bc.body like '%<ac:link>%');
{code}
Then search the question title and remove the page link from both comment and/or answer.

You can also try the query below to identify which Questions have links to the affected page:
{code:sql}
SELECT contentid AS "Content ID"
     , title     AS "Question"
FROM content
WHERE contentid IN ( SELECT DISTINCT(c.parentccid)
                       FROM CONTENT c
                       JOIN BODYCONTENT bc ON c.contentid = bc.contentid
                      WHERE c.pluginkey IN ('com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer', 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:comment')
                        AND c.contentid IN ( SELECT l.contentid
                                               FROM links l
                                              WHERE l.lowerdestspacekey = '<lower space key>'
                                                AND l.lowerdestpagetitle = '<lower page title>' ));
{code}
*Case 2:*

Find the answer drafts with the affected page link
{code:java}
SELECT contentid, title, pluginkey
FROM content
WHERE pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer-draft' and contentid in (
        SELECT contentid
        FROM links
        WHERE lowerdestpagetitle = 'incoming link test') {code}
Remove the link associations from links table could make view page information working again
{code:java}
DELETE 
FROM links
WHERE contentid = 12345;
{code}
Or in a single query
{code:java}
DELETE 
FROM links
WHERE contentid in (SELECT contentid
        FROM content
        WHERE pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer-draft' and contentid in (
                SELECT contentid
                FROM links
                WHERE lowerdestpagetitle = 'incoming link test'
        )
)         {code}
Note: the links in draft are not loaded in editor and safe to be deleted. It seems the editor always load `current` answer in editor after refreshing the answer edit page, which means refreshing edit answer page breaks view page information again. The following queries doesn't prevent that.
{code:java}
DELETE 
FROM bodycontent
WHERE contentid = 12345;

DELETE 
FROM contentproperties
WHERE contentid = 12345;

DELETE 
FROM links
WHERE contentid = 12345;

DELETE 
FROM content
WHERE contentid = 12345; 
{code}
fields.summary: Page info failed on incoming link rendering

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In large environments, where spaces may contain several thousand pages, overall performance of Confluence can degrade due to required permissions lookups for pages in the page tree.
h4. Actual Behavior

When a page tree is in use and a user views a page in a space using page tree, there is a permissions lookup which takes place for every page listed in the page tree. If the space has several thousand pages, this lookup can become very expensive when performed for multiple users accessing the space.

The performance impact tends to happen when there is a concurrent cache lock issue during the cache eviction. These permissions lookups can take a long time and when multiple users view pages in the space (causing this action to take place), it causes a new thread to be used for each user. If many or all threads are in use for this action due to the cache lock, it can lead to performance problems on the site as fewer threads are available for other operations.
h4. Expected Behavior

Permissions lookups, regardless of whether they are cached, should take place in the background, be less expensive, and not affect the performance of the site.
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*This issue was resolved in Confluence 7.3*. We now load a maximum of 200 pages at each level of the page hierarchy in the sidebar. A *Show all pages* button will appear if there are pages that have not been loaded. You can change this page tree behaviour using the following system properties:
 * page-tree.partial-loading-batch-size
 * page-tree.partial-loading.disable

See [Recognized System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recognized+System+Properties] more information.
{panel}

h2. Symptoms

From the user perspective, the site may be sluggish and simply display a waiting (spinning) icon while the browser waits on the server to respond to a page view request.

This issue can be confirmed via thread dumps, and you may find hints in a heap dump too.
h4. Thread Dump Examples

Thread dumps should be taken to confirm the issue. The key piece here is the blocking (RUNNABLE) thread and all blocked threads were executing this piece of code:
{code:java}
net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache.get(ReadWriteCache.java:69)
{code}

{code}
Looking at the http-nio-8080-exec-1863, this thread obtained *net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache*'s lock & did not release it. Due to that 1596 threads are BLOCKED:
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-1863" #57426 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f3858606000 nid=0x45eb waiting for monitor entry [0x00007f31ce9c3000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache.get(ReadWriteCache.java:69)
	- waiting to lock <0x00007f3a4650d6a8> (a net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hibernate.SwitchableCacheConcurrencyStrategy.get(SwitchableCacheConcurrencyStrategy.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hibernate.ConfluenceCacheStrategy.get(ConfluenceCacheStrategy.java:49)
	...
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject.getContentPermissionSet(ContentEntityObject.java:1083)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.hasContentLevelPermissionIgnoreInherited(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.hasContentLevelPermission(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:202)
	...
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.PagePermissionsDelegate.hasContentLevelViewPermission(PagePermissionsDelegate.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.PagePermissionsDelegate.canView(PagePermissionsDelegate.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.TargetToLatestVersionDecorator.canView(TargetToLatestVersionDecorator.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor$$Lambda$1007/1154506160.test(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor.checkAccess(SharedAccessInterceptor.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor.canView(SharedAccessInterceptor.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.Permission$1.checkAgainst(Permission.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions(DefaultPermissionManager.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionManager.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.getPermittedEntities(DefaultPermissionManager.java:126)
	...
	at com.adaptavist.confluence.naturalchildren.NaturalChildrenAction.getAllPermittedStartPages(NaturalChildrenAction.java:262)
{code}
h4. Heap Dump

In this case, the heap was filled by {{org.hibernate.engine.internal.StatefulPersistenceContext}} objects (at around 12.6GB and 14.6GB out of 28GB of heap. Please refer to the screenshot below:
 !heap1.png|thumbnail!

A big chunk of the {{org.hibernate.engine.internal.StatefulPersistenceContext}} objects are associated to TaskThread, in which are trying to retrieve content permission as shown in the sample thread details' snippet below:
{code:java}
http-nio-8080-exec-3592
  at net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache.get(Ljava/lang/Object;J)Ljava/lang/Object; (ReadWriteCache.java:69)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hibernate.SwitchableCacheConcurrencyStrategy.get(Ljava/lang/Object;J)Ljava/lang/Object; (SwitchableCacheConcurrencyStrategy.java:29)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hibernate.ConfluenceCacheStrategy.get(Ljava/lang/Object;J)Ljava/lang/Object; (ConfluenceCacheStrategy.java:49)
  ...
  at com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl_$$_jvstd8c_3.getName()Ljava/lang/String; (Unknown Source)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission.compareTo(Lcom/atlassian/confluence/security/ContentPermission;)I (ContentPermission.java:253)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission.compareTo(Ljava/lang/Object;)I (ContentPermission.java:31)
  at java.util.TreeMap.put(Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Object;)Ljava/lang/Object; (TreeMap.java:568)
...
{code}
h4. Logs

Logs may contain entries like the following:
{code:java}
2018-04-18 23:12:35,776 WARN [http-nio-8080-exec-883] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1524093066939, threadId=1123, threadName='http-nio-8080-exec-883', userId='abc123', type='web-request', summary='/plugins/pagetree/naturalchildren.action?decorator=none&excerpt=false&sort=position&reverse=false&disableLinks=false&expandCurrent=true&hasRoot=true&pageId=348115741&treeId=0&startDepth=0&mobile=false&ancestors=366428612&ancestors=348115741&treePageId=366428767'}
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/pagetree/naturalchildren.action
{code}
h4. Cache Statistics

Looking at the relted cache statistics we see a very high (100%) capacity utilization but a very low effectiveness (5% - 17%) for the following caches:
 * Content Permissions
 * Space Permissions (by ID)
 * Content Properties
 * Embedded Crowd Internal User
 * Content Objects
 * Page Children

As seen in this example:
 !cache.png|thumbnail! !cache2.png|thumbnail!
h2. Synopsis

In this case, there was a permissions lookup triggered by a plugin. This lookup tried to retrieve the data from cache, but a concurrent cache lock issue occurred during the cache eviction. In the above example when the lock was obtained, all other threads needing a lock on {{net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache}} had to wait for the first thread to finish. Due to this a large amount of threads built up waiting on the same task. This buildup of blocked threads resulted in very few threads being available to perform other actions and resulted in a performance impact to Confluence as users were not able to use the site.

This was discovered to be caused by a large space changing the sidebar display from *Child Pages* to *Page Tree* thus resulting in a larger number of pages listed in the sidebar, leading to more permissions lookups.
h2. Workarounds

The workarounds for this issue until the code is optimized, is to either tune the Confluence cache, and/or discontinue the use of the Page Tree view in large space's sidebars.

This query will identify which space keys use each sidebar configuration:
{code:java}
# select bandanacontext, bandanavalue from bandana where bandanakey = 'sidebar.nav-type';
 bandanacontext |        bandanavalue
----------------+----------------------------
 ds             | <string>page-tree</string>
 TEST           | <string>pages</string>
(2 rows)
{code}
 * page-tree = Page Tree view
 * pages = Child Pages view

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
(!) *PLEASE READ*: As with all recommendations made by Atlassian Support, please follow best practices for Change Management and *test and validate* these settings in a Test/Development and Staging environment *prior to* rolling any changes into a Production environment. This is to validate these changes and ensure that they will function will within your infrastructure prior to placing these changes in production.

(!) *PLEASE READ*: There is additional advice given at the end of this comment which should be read *before* you move forward with tuning the caches in the environment. It is better to start with the infrastructure components to determine if any adjustments are necessary before adjusting the caches within Confluence.
{panel}
You should *only* consider increasing the caches below, when the *capacity utilization is high (at or near 100%)* and the *effectiveness percentage is low (under 20%)*. That is to say, if capacity utilization is at 100% and the effectiveness percentage is very low ~(1 - 20%), those caches are candidates for alteration of the cache settings to increase the number of objects stored in memory.

Based upon the Cache view shown above, the candidate objects for cache alteration are:
 * Content Permissions
 * Space Permissions (by ID)
 * Content Properties
 * Embedded Crowd Internal User
 * Content Objects
 * Page Children

Any other objects should not be modified. If you are not sure whether or how to proceed, please contact support before making any changes to the cache.
h5. Suggestions on how large the size should be adjusted

The basic formula to apply for a conservative approach would be to mark this as follows:
{code:java}
New Cache Size = Current Cache Size x 1.5
{code}
This basically means that the cache objects would be 150% of their current size. This could then be tested to determine how effective the cache would be in response to these changes. You may need to iterate through several adjustment and observation periods to make these caches more effective.
h4. Adjusting the Cache

To change the size of a cache
 # Go to  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/590259974/Cog.png! > *General Configuration* > *Cache Management*.
 # Choose *Show Advanced View*.
 # Choose *Adjust Size* next to the cache you want to change.

To modify other parameters you can modify the cache configuration files manually.
 * Cache configurations are stored in {{<confluence-home>/shared-home/config/cache-settings-overrides.properties}}
 * For Confluence Data Center (clustered) it can be found in {{<confluence-shared-home>/config/cache-settings-overrides.properties}} (in the shared home directory for the cluster).

h4. Additional Advice

Depending on the database you are using within the environment, it may also be worthwhile to run any statistics, tuning or performance analysis provided by the native database tools for that repository. Doing so may provide you with additional instructions that may provide significant performance increases *without* resorting to altering the caches in the instance. I recommend involving your DBA as a rebuild of the indexes may provide significant performance improvement in itself.
h5. Reference

Recommended reading: [Cache Performance Tuning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Cache+Performance+Tuning]
fields.summary: Pagetree naturalchildren.action permissions lookup can cause a concurrent cache lock and impact Confluence Performance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* Different subscription link resulted when generating ical URL through clicking on top button 'Subscribe' and generating it through '***' drop down menu

h3.Environment
Team calendar version :5.5.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to 'Subscribe' button on top of the calendar
# The generated URL looks like [http://localhost:6604/c604/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/export/subcalendar/undefined.ics?os_authType=basic&isSubscribe=true]
# Go to "***" list drop down menu and click on subscribe option
# The generated URL looks like [http://localhost:6604/c604/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/export/subcalendar/2ff8cf86-275f-441b-95ce-9cf3fe23f712.ics?os_authType=basic&isSubscribe=true]

h3. Expected Results
  The correct URL generated with ID.ics
h3. Actual Results
The URL changed to "undefined.ics" when subscribe through top button.
 
h3.Workaround
Use the drop down menus only.

h3.Notes
Attached video for reproduction
fields.summary: Team calendar subscription URL generate undefined.ics

fields.description:
It's a real show stopped you always have to switch between read mode and edit mode in order to be able to work with inline comments in a productive way.

This is in fact an open issue since 3 years but unfortunately has been closed by mistake.
[https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36685|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36685]
fields.summary: Work with Inline Comments in Edit Mode

fields.description:
Links to anchors work if the user is logged in when she clicks them but if she is not logged in she will get the login page and then be directed only to the page from the link, not to the anchor in the page.

For example:
clicking this link while not logged in should go straight to the anchor:
http://servername:8090/display/test/Anchor#Anchor-test
instead, after logging in the browser is redirected to:
http://servername:8090/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=test&title=Anchor
when it should redirect to:
http://servername:8090/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=test&title=Anchor#Anchor-test

To reproduce, create an anchor, then a link the anchor. Log out of Confluence and click the link to the anchor.
Result:
After you log in you are directed to the top of the page on the link.
Expected result:
After you log in you should be directed to the anchor on the page not the top of the page.
fields.summary: Links to Anchors Don't Work if User is not Logged in

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unwanted line break is inserted when pasting some text immediately after undo action.

h3. Environment

* Collaborative editing is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open a new page in edit mode
# Paste some text
# Undo (Ctrl + Z)
# Paste the text again

h3. Expected Results

Unwanted line break shouldn't be inserted.

h3. Actual Results

Unwanted line break is inserted right before the pasted text.
fields.summary: Unwanted line break is inserted when pasting some text immediately after undo action

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In case that collaborative editing is *disabled*, unwanted line break is inserted when pasting text around table.
Please see the steps to reproduce section for the detail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Disable collaborative editing
# Open a new page in edit mode
# Create a table (1×1)
# Paste some text right after the table
# Paste some text in the table

h3. Expected Results

Unwanted line breaks shouldn't be inserted.

h3. Actual Results

After the step 4, unwanted line break is inserted between the table and the pasted text. (It doesn't happen sometime.)
After the step 5, unwanted line break is inserted between the table and the text you pasted in the step 4.

 [^CONFSERVER-55382.mov]
fields.summary: Unwanted line break is inserted when pasting text around table
Marco {jira:ABC-123} works differently when I post content via REST API or XML RPC

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Setting "Hide Summary" on Single Jira issue macro then editing that JIM again will reset and remove "Hide Summary" from the macro.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Single Jira issue macro on a page.
# When page is published in summary of the issue will be visible.
# Edit the page once again and click on the JIM.
# Tick "Hide Summary"
# Publish the page and observe that summary is now gone.
# Edit the page once again
# Edit the JIM to point to a new issue.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
Issue will not show summary.

h3. Actual Results
Issue will show summary.

h3.Workaround
After editing the JIM reapply the Hide Summary feature to JIM.
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro functionality hide summary will be reset if JIM is edited again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users report that when restoring the space logo (avatar) to the default Confluence logo, the Confluence logo is not set when they click save. Instead, a blank logo is displayed. The issue is confirmed to happen in Safari, IE and Edge with each giving different symptoms.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Safari*
 # In a space, click Space Tools > Configure Sidebar > Edit Space Details (pencil icon)
 # Upload a new icon and click Save > Done.
 # Re-do step (1) above.
 # Click restore default > Save > Done.

*Edge / IE*
 # In a space, click Space Tools > Configure Sidebar > Edit Space Details (pencil icon) .
 # Click restore default > Save > Done.

h3. Expected Results

The default Confluence logo will become the space's logo
h3. Actual Results

*Safari*
 The space's logo is blank

*Edge*
 The space's logo is blank

*IE*
 When clicking on "restore default", the form tries to save but nothing happens (infinite load). Check the screenshot IE.png.
fields.summary: Issue restoring to default Confluence logo in spaces
LifecycleAware onStop does not get called when plugin is uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Password Fields are still being displayed when creating new user into an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Confluence with [Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-an-internal-directory-with-ldap-authentication-229838462.html]
# Position the Delegated Directory in the top position so a new user can be added into this directory
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! > *User management* > *Add Users*
# Attempt to create a new user

h3. Expected Results
Since this is a directory with delegated authentication. The *Password* and *Confirm Password* fields shouldn't appear as it is irrelevant


h3. Actual Results
The *Password* and *Confirm Password* fields are there as *Required Fields*
 !Add User.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Password Fields are still being displayed when creating new user into an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication

fields.summary: Update File Previewer to open and display TBL files as text

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When right clicking the "Create" button within a space which you have create page restrictions, you will be directed to a page which prominently displays: "confluence.request.access.pagerestricted.requestaccess.title.edit.$contentType" and underneath it, "A space admin or the person who shared this page may be able to give you access."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space as user A.  Restrict user B from creating pages, but leave view access.
# Log in as user B and access above space.  
# Right click create button.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 6.18.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

I believe the expected results would be that this page shows, "No Permission", instead of "confluence.request.access.pagerestricted.requestaccess.title.edit.$contentType"
fields.summary: Right clicking on "Create" within a space you have no permission to create, shows a broken "No Permission" page
Right clicking on "Create" within a space you have no permission to create, shows a broken permission page

fields.description:
I would like to officially request support for running Confluence Software Data Center version specifically, in Docker containers. There are some community versions of docker containers available, or we can build our own containers (though an official dockerfile provided by Atlassian would obviously be welcome), but we will have no official support from Atlassian in the event of something going wrong (unless I am missing something?).

So, this request isn't really for providing docker container versions of major versions of Confluence, but rather the support of running this as an enterprise option.

Of course, in a world where upgrading is supposed to happen faster and faster, and become more and more automated, having the ability to make the upgrade process easier, and enabled as part of an automation pipeline, would obviously be incredibly useful.
fields.summary: Official support for running Confluence data center in docker containers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Given a Confluence page with a title that includes an apostrophe (E.g. Dave's Page Test), search results using Livesearch macro returns the title's name with apostrophe replaced by ' (E.g. Dave's Page Test)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page with a title that includes and apostrophe. (e.g. "Dave's Page Test")
 # Add a Livesearch macro in the body of the page or in a different Confluence page.
 # Search for "Dave's Page Test"

h3. Expected Results

Livesearch results will display "Dave's Page Test" correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Livesearch results will display "Dave&#39s Page Test".

!Screen Shot 2018-04-17 at 8.58.37 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro search results displays ' instead of apostrophe

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Videos that has 1920 x 1090 resolutions cannot run on IE, Edge and Safari. In IE/Edge when the video thumbnail is clicked the video player will only show a blank screen. In Safari it will show "Ouch! We can't load the media file" error message. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a video with resolution (1920X1090) to a Confluence page. 
# Save or Update the Confluence Page.
# Click on the video 

h3. Expected Results
Video player able to render and play the video while using IE/Edge or Safari.

h3. Actual Results
# In IE/Edge when the video thumbnail is clicked the video player will only show a blank screen. 
# In Safari it will show "Ouch! We can't load the media file" error message. 
 
h3.Workaround
Resize the the video to 1920 x 1080 and 1280 X 738. Other resolutions might work as well but it has not been tested.
fields.summary: MP4 video with resolution 1920X1090 cannot be played in IE/Edge or Safari

fields.description:
h1. Background
A custom content and its container could be related to different spaces.
It could happen if the page is moved to another space.
As a result, the import process of such spaces could fail with "could not execute statement".

h1. Expected behaviour
Custom objects and their containers must be related to the same space.

h1. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/importing-a-space-fails-with-could-not-execute-statement-error-in-confluence-server-949242294.html

h1. Additional information
To test if database is affected by bug, this script could be run:
{code}
SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CONTENT
JOIN CONTENT xpage ON CONTENT.PAGEID = xpage.CONTENTID
WHERE CONTENT.SPACEID != xpage.SPACEID
AND CONTENT.CONTENTTYPE = 'CUSTOM';
{code}

If it returns non-zero value, database is affected by this bug.
fields.summary: A custom content and its container could be related to different spaces

fields.description:
h1. Background

An attachment and its container could be related to different spaces.
 It could happen if the page is moved to another space.
 As a result, the import process of such spaces could fail with "could not execute statement".
h1. Expected behaviour

Attachments and their containers must be related to the same space.

h1. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/importing-a-space-fails-with-could-not-execute-statement-error-in-confluence-server-949242294.html

h1. Additional information

To test if database is affected by bug, this script could be run:
{code:java}
SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CONTENT
JOIN CONTENT xpage ON CONTENT.PAGEID = xpage.CONTENTID
WHERE CONTENT.SPACEID != xpage.SPACEID
AND CONTENT.CONTENTTYPE = 'ATTACHMENT';
{code}
If it returns non-zero value, database is affected by this bug.
fields.summary: An attachment and its container could be related to different spaces

fields.description:
h1. Background

A page has a set of previous versions. Sometimes previous versions could have different parents or different spaces. Parents could be either from current space or from other spaces.
 It could happen if the page is moved to another page or space.
 As a result, the import process of such spaces could fail with "could not execute statement".
h1. Expected behaviour

Previous versions must not have different parents or spaces.

h1. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/importing-a-space-fails-with-could-not-execute-statement-error-in-confluence-server-949242294.html

h1. Additional information
To test if database is affected by bug, this script could be run:
{code}
SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM CONTENT
JOIN CONTENT xpage ON CONTENT.PREVVER = xpage.CONTENTID
WHERE CONTENT.SPACEID != xpage.SPACEID;
{code}

If it returns non-zero value, database is affected by this bug.
fields.summary: A historical version of the content could have a different parent

fields.description:

Office 365 is currently no official support for Confluence according to our knowledge base

To support office 365

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When deleting the only version of the attachment, AttachmentTrashedEvent is not triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to a page
# Go to the attachments view
# Delete the version of the attachment as shown in the screenshot

h3. Expected Results
AttachmentTrashedEvent will be fired

h3. Actual Results
The full attachment is deleted but an AttachmentVersionRemovedEvent is triggered

h3.Workaround
When deleting the only version, delete the attachment instead
fields.summary: AttachmentTrashedEvent is not trigger when the last version of an attachment is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While editing page, Image edit property panel will not appear when clicking on images on pages with busier images and text and using Page Layout Sections
h3. Environment
 * IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new blank page
 # Add Two Column Section and populate with random text
 !page layout columns.png|thumbnail!
 # Add Single Column Section and populate with text and images
 # Add 1-2 more Single Column Sections and populate with random text
 # Save page
 # Open the page in IE11, Edit and try to edit images by clicking on them

h3. Expected Results

Image Edit panel is opened
 !image edit.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Image panel will not appear, or will not appear for some images, the more content on the page, the less likely the panel to appear
The page will also flicker when clicking images, as described in CONFSERVER-51548 bug
h3. Notes
 * Removing columns will bring edit panel back
 * Issues can be temporarily removed:
 ## While in developer mode (shortcut F12) > DOM Explorer
 ## Locate "class="innerCell"" CSS class and remove class value:
This
{code:java}
<div class="innerCell" contenteditable="true">
{code}
Into this:
{code:java}
<div class="" contenteditable="true">
{code}

 # 
 ## Image editing panel will start appearing, at the same time flickering described in CONFSERVER-51548 will also stop

 * A test space export is attached for further testing: [^IE11_test.xml.zip]

h3. Workaround

The issue is not observed on other major supported browsers
fields.summary: Image edit via IE11 is not possible on pages with sections and more content
